Detailed Description

This module defines support for IDL type codes, a part of the CORBA specification which describes a mechanism to represent IDL types at runtime. RTI Data Distribution Service can use type codes to send information about types on the wire.

Type codes are values that are used to describe arbitrarily complex IDL types at runtime. Type code values are manipulated via the com.rti.dds.typecode.TypeCode interface, which is derived from a CORBA-specified API. Conceptually, a type code value consists of a type code kind (represented by the com.rti.dds.typecode.TCKind enumeration) and a parameter list. Note that for compound types like structs and arrays, the parameter list will recursively include one or more type code values.

There are a number of uses for type codes. The type code mechanism can be used to unambiguously match type representations. The com.rti.dds.typecode.TypeCode.equal method is a more reliable test than comparing the string type names, requiring equivalent IDL definitions of the types. In addition to being used locally, RTI Data Distribution Service 4.1 adds support for transmitting a serialized version on the wire between participants. Type codes can be used to access information about types at runtime, for example to be able to publish or subscribe to topics of arbitrarily types. This functionality is useful for a generic system monitoring tool like NDDSSpy.

Type codes are enabled by default when running Nddsgen; the serialized version of a typecode will be published during discovery. The -notypecode option to Nddsgen can be used to disable generation of typecode information. An extended field for the type code information has been added to the builtin types for publications and subscriptions. To support especially complex type codes, it may be necessary to increase the value of the DomainParticipant's com.rti.dds.infrastructure.DomainParticipantResourceLimitsQosPolicy.type_code_max_serialized_length.

Accessing TypeCode information:

Locally, a TypeCode may be accessed via the FooTypeCode.VALUE member in the code for the type generated by Nddsgen (unless type code support is disabled). On the wire, this information is transmitted during discovery over the publication and subscription builtin topics. They can be accessed using the builtin readers for these topics. The TypeCode values are not cached by RTI Data Distribution Service upon reciept and are therefore not available from the built-in data returned by com.rti.dds.publication.DataWriter.get_matched_subscription_data or com.rti.dds.subscription.DataReader.get_matched_publication_data.

Creating Type Codes at run-time (Dynamic Type Code API):

The Type Code API includes support for dynamic generation of TypeCode values. Type codes for simple types such as short and char are static values in the TypeCode class such as com.rti.dds.typecode.TypeCode.TC_SHORT and com.rti.dds.typecode.TypeCode.TC_CHAR. Compound type codes are generated using the com.rti.dds.typecode.TypeCodeFactory interface.

See also:
rtiddsgen, builtin.SubscriptionBuiltinTopicData, builtin.PublicationBuiltinTopicData
